_88Code_Airport_IATA.description: IATA defined 3 char airport code or location identifier

_88Code_Airport_ICAO.description: ICAO defined 4 char airport or location code as per ICAO doc 7910

_88String_Character_One.description:
Single  character string
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 1

_88DateTime.description:
XSD DateTime allows either a time-zone specification or allows the time-zone to be omitted. 
When omitted, times are "local". XSD DateTime with either a "Z" or a "+/-hh:mm" value are UTC. Time is the time "in the indicated time zone". When a element or attribute has xsd:dateTime type, the data in a message can be either local or UTC and software can easily determine which it is.

_88String_Tiny.description:
A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

$eref.description:
Single  character string
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 1

_88FlightNumber_Suffix.description: Single upper case letter used to distinguish multiple flights of the same number originating on the same date.

_88String_Long.description:
A long string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 4096

_88Code_Agency_IATA.description: IATA  defined 2 or 3 char code for an agency or airline acting as an agency

_88String_UpperCaseAlphaNumeric.description:
Upper Case Alpha Numeric string with no whitespace
Minimum length of 0 and maximum length of 4096

_88Code_Country_ISO_3.description: ISO 3 char country code as defined in ISO 3166-1 standard

_88FlightNumber_With_Suffix.description: a 1-4 numeric flight number with an alpha suffix

_88Code_Agency_IATA_Number.description: IATA agency number - An 8-digit numerical code that uniquely identifies travel agencies and other entities engaged in the sale of travel

_88DateTime_WithTimeZone.description: ISO date time type with restriction to assure time has the UTC offset or Z for Zulu. Example: 2010-12-31T11:55:00+06:00  or 2010-12-31T11:55:00Z

_88String_UpperCaseAlpha.description:
Upper Case Alpha string with no whitespace 
Minimum length of 0 and maximum length of 4096

_88Code_Railway_Station_IATA.description:
IATA codes for railway stations begin with Q, X or Z, except when the station shares the code with an airport.

Railway stations are typically used in air-rail alliances or code sharing agreements (commonly known as "Rail Fly"). Commonly used in Europe

_88String.description: A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.

_88Code_Language_ISO_3.description: ISO 3 char  language code defined in  ISO639-2

_88Code_Country.description: ISO 2 char country code  - Preferred country code is the 2 character country code as defined in ISO 3166-1

_88String_Text.description:
A string intended for free text 
Minimum length of 0 and maximum length of 4096

_88Code_Currency.description: Currency code - Preferred currencty code is a 3 char currency code as defined in ISO 4127

_88String_Short.description:
A short string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128

_88Code_Airline_IATA.description:
IATA defined 2 character airline designator codes, (IATA Airline Coding Directory, Section 3)
This type will not support  IATA 3 char airline designator codes. There are no IATA 3 char airline codes assigned at this time.

_88String_AlphaNumeric.description:
Alpha Numeric string with no whitespace
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 4096

_88Code_Language.description: Preferred language code is the 2 character ISO 639-1 defined Language code - common usage

_88Code_Airline_ICAO.description:
ICAO defined 3 Letter Airline Code 
(defined by ICAO 8585)

_88DateTime_Local.description:
ISO date time type without UTC offset or Z for Zulu restriction indicating it is representing Local Time
Example: 2010-12-31T11:55:00
